page.title: 05SCHOOLS IN THE AREA
page.content: Public education has been provided for the past 12 years by 1st and Middle schools contributing pupils from Saltdean, Woodingdean, Rottingdean and Ovingdean to Longhill High School. Longhill was built in 1963 and in September reverts to the traditional transfer age of 11. Pupils may leve at 16 for work or into the Youth Training Scheme, or transfer to a 6th Form College in Brighton. Facilities exist outside the immediate area for FE especially of a Technical nature Private education is procided at one Prep. school in Rottingdean up to 13. Limited part time education is available in the evenings at Longhill with a much wider choice of subjects within easy travelling distance.
